sentences.cn: 事实是难以搪塞的东西.

sentences.en: He is as stubborn as a mule.
He was too stubborn to admit that he was wrong.
He's as stubborn as a mule .
His opponents viewed him as stubborn, dogmatic, and inflexible.
sentences.cn: 他的反对者们认为他固执、教条、僵化。

sentences.en: I cannot cope with that boy; he is stubborn.
sentences.cn: 我对付不了那个孩子, 他很固执.

sentences.en: I’ve got a very stubborn streak (= a tendency to be stubborn ) .
Mick was stubborn and domineering with a very bad temper.
sentences.cn: 米克既固执又专横，脾气还很坏。

sentences.en: Paul can be as stubborn as a mule (= very stubborn ) .
Serves her right for being so stubborn.
Stubborn, self - confident Guo Zhenshan has never gone crawling to anyone.
sentences.cn: 坚强 、 自信 、有气魄的郭振山,实在说,永远也不会向人低三下四啊!

sentences.en: The drawer is very stubborn; it doesn't open easily.
sentences.cn: 这个抽屉很别扭, 不好开.

sentences.en: The more Sarah nagged her, the more stubborn Cissie became.
sentences.cn: 萨拉越对茜茜唠叨，茜茜越是固执。

sentences.en: This treatment removes the most stubborn stains.
sentences.cn: 这个方法能清除大多数顽固污渍。

sentences.en: When he's in his stubborn mood , he isn't easily talked round.
sentences.cn: 他那股牛劲上来了, 一时不容易说服.

phrases.tran_cn: 事实是不容改变的东西

trans.tran_cn: 顽固的，固执的，顽强的或有决心的，坚持的，棘手的
trans.tran_en: determined not to change your mind, even when people think you are being unreasonable
